free_text.Note: Class divided in two groups with alternate lectures. 9 first weeks: teaching by Dr L.F. de alencastro and Dr S. Knispel, 5 last weeks: teaching by Prof. Ludwig. A part of the lectures is given in French, another in English.
free_text.Prerequisite for: Specialization in environmental Chemistry and Bioprocesses
free_text.Content: [br/][li]Analysis of natural water[br/][tab]physical and chemical parameters[br/][tab]field equipment[br/][li]Sediment analysis[br/][tab]organic and metallic pollutants [br/][tab]solvent extraction[br/][tab]identification and quantification of the pollutants[br/][li]Chromatographic methods of separation[br/][li]Analysis by ICP[br/][li]Biological Index[br/][li]Speciation as a tool to understand the behaviour of pollutants[br/][li]Application[br/][tab]Study of the contamination of an ecosystem (river)[br/][tab]Practical determination and use of complex formation constants[br/][br/][br/][br/]
free_text.Keywords: Physico-chemical analysis, macrozoobenthos, micropollutants, water, sediments
free_text.Learning outcomes: Practical application of the theoretical teaching (4th. semester) in the field of environmental chemistry.[br/]Knowing how to analyze organic and metallic pollutants in soils, sediments and water[br/]Getting insight into the role of complexing agents on the fate of toxic trace metals[br/]Laboratory and field approach.[br/]Treatment and interpretation of the results.[br/]Evaluation of the water quality by mean of biological organisms

free_text.Remarque: La classe est divisée en deux groupes, cours alternés. Les 9 premières semaines concernant l'enseignement de Dr L.F. de Alencastro et Dr S. Knispel, les 5 dernières, l'enseignement de Prof. Ch. Ludwig.[br/]Une partie des cours est donnée en français, une autre en anglais.
